name: electricity voltage transformation from high to medium voltage, aluminium industry | electricity, medium voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23001/documentation

This dataset represents the transformation of electricity voltage from high to medium voltage. It is specific to the electricity mix consumed by the aluminium industry in Canada. It includes transformation losses. Capital goods are however included in electricity markets.;It is assumed the primary aluminium industry consumes medium voltage electricity.;This dataset represents the transformation of electricity voltage from high to medium voltage.;Definition of the voltage levels:; - High voltage level above 24 kV (large scale industry); - Medium voltage level between 1 kV and 24 kV (medium to small scale industry, service sector;and public buildings); - Low voltage level below 1 kV (Households);;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

This activity starts with the high voltage electricity arriving at the transformer station.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity transformed to medium voltage. 
This dataset includes the losses during voltage transformation.
It doesn't include the transformer station itself as this is included in the dataset for the transmission network.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2016 data from AAC
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Losses are specific to the aluminium industry in that they are calculated as the aluminium industry electricity consumption weighted average of losses of substituted regions (British Columbia and Quebec) based on the amount of electricity produced per aluminium production.
